sub_title: Freelance vertaler Nederlands ‚Üí Duits & Duitse (SEO) tekstschrijver | Native speaker Duits
summary:
‚Ä¢ German Native speaker
‚Ä¢ Freelance German translator and copywriter 
‚Ä¢ Experience in (online) marketing and sales

I strive to deliver high quality texts: flawless and appealing German texts with a clear and nuanced message. During my work I think along with the client and take all the important factors like style or the medium / context as well as of course the target audience and cultural differences into account.

I am available for: 
‚Ä¢ Translations from Dutch to German (NL-DE)
‚Ä¢ Proofreading / correction of German texts
‚Ä¢ German copywriting (for websites, social media, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Writing / Translating SEO- texts and metadata (evt. keyword analysis in consultation with the customer)
‚Ä¢ Translations from English to German and from Norwegian to German (EN-DE, NO-DE)

I have extensive experience in translating (Dutch to German) and writing a variety of commercial and informative texts for different target audiences, B2B as well as B2C:
‚Ä¢ (SEO) content for German websites / webshops (including metadata): product texts, category texts, customer service information, corporate and brand information
‚Ä¢ Texts with limited length (menu`s and buttons, SEA ads, meta tags, flyers)
‚Ä¢ Newsletters
‚Ä¢ E-mail notifications (concerning orders, customer accounts, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Facebook-posts
‚Ä¢ Press releases 
‚Ä¢ Informative children‚Äôs books (translation of the four-part series ‚ÄòUnder the microscope‚Äô)
‚Ä¢ Folders, catalogues, magazine ads

Proofreading experience:
‚Ä¢ Final correction of new German informative children‚Äôs books before printing at the publisher Ars Scribendi (trading as Schoolsupport)
‚Ä¢ Newsletters

About myself:
I was born and raised in Bavaria, Germany. Although I have never owned a ‚ÄòDirndl‚Äô, ‚ÄòWei√übier‚Äô and ‚ÄòSp√§tzle‚Äô are definitely part of my DNA üòä For my studies, a Magister‚Äôs degree (equivalent to Master of Arts) in languages and literature combined with business studies, I moved to Baden-W√ºrttemberg. During a semester abroad I met my husband, a Dutchman, so that I ended up in Breda after finishing university. I have been living and working in the beautiful Netherlands since 2010, while I often return to my home country during vacation. I love languages, speak several languages amongst which fluent Dutch, and like to be creative. Fortunately I have also some of the  well-known German thoroughness in me as well as attention to detail, which is essential for my profession.
